result.definition: an instance or single occasion for some event
result.example: "this time he succeeded"; "he called four times"; "he could do ten at a clip"
result.synonyms: magazine, clip, snip, clipping, metre, sentence, prison term, fourth dimension, time, cartridge holder, meter, cartridge clip, clock time

result.definition: a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something
result.example: "take time to smell the roses"; "I didn't have time to finish"; "it took more than half my time"
result.synonyms: metre, clock time, clip, prison term, sentence, fourth dimension, meter

result.definition: an indefinite period (usually marked by specific attributes or activities)
result.example: "he waited a long time"; "the time of year for planting"; "he was a great actor in his time"
result.synonyms: metre, clock time, clip, prison term, sentence, fourth dimension, meter
metre, clock time, clip, prison term, sentence, fourth dimension, meter

result.definition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
result.synonyms: metre, clock time, clip, prison term, sentence, fourth dimension, meter

result.definition: a person's experience on a particular occasion
result.example: "he had a time holding back the tears"; "they had a good time together"
result.synonyms: metre, clock time, clip, prison term, sentence, fourth dimension, meter

result.definition: a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
result.example: "do you know what time it is?"; "the time is 10 o'clock"
result.synonyms: clip, metre, sentence, prison term, fourth dimension, meter, time, clock time

result.definition: the fourth coordinate that is required (along with three spatial dimensions) to specify a physical event
result.synonyms: clip, metre, sentence, prison term, fourth dimension, meter, time, clock time

result.definition: rhythm as given by division into parts of equal duration
result.synonyms: measure, meter, clip, m, cadence, metre, sentence, prison term, fourth dimension, beat, time, clock time

result.definition: the period of time a prisoner is imprisoned
result.example: "he served a prison term of 15 months"; "his sentence was 5 to 10 years"; "he is doing time in the county jail"
result.synonyms: conviction, clip, condemnation, sentence, prison term, fourth dimension, judgment of conviction, metre, meter, time, clock time

result.definition: measure the time or duration of an event or action or the person who performs an action in a certain period of time
assign a time for an activity or event
result.example: "The candidate carefully timed his appearance at the disaster scene"

result.definition: set the speed, duration, or execution of
result.example: "we time the process to manufacture our cars very precisely"

result.definition: regulate or set the time of
adjust so that a force is applied and an action occurs at the desired time
result.example: "The good player times his swing so as to hit the ball squarely"
